item.title: Lina add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Freedom lies in being bold." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Lina add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "With school turning out more runners, jumpers, racers, tinkerers, grabbers, snatchers, fliers, and swimmers instead of examiners, critics, knowers, and imaginative creators, the word 'intellectual,' of course, became the swear word it deserved to be." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Lina add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Lina add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lina add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Lina add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Lina add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Lina add a quote by Alfred de Musset
item.description: "How glorious it is – and also how painful – to be an exception. " -- Alfred de Musset

item.title: Lina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Lina add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out." -- Mae West
